title: Sunderland appoint Phil Parkinson as new manager on two-and-a-half-year contract
text:
Sunderland have appointed Phil Parkinson as their new manager on a two-and-a-half-year contract.

As exclusively revealed by Telegraph Sport, the 51 year-old, who will be assisted by Steve Parkin, replaces Jack Ross after the Scot was relieved of his duties earlier this month following a 2-0 League One defeat at Lincoln, just the Black Cats' second in all competitions this season.

Chairman Stewart Donald said: "Phil has a proven track record when it comes to achieving promotion and I'm delighted to welcome him to Sunderland.

"During a rigorous recruitment process, it gradually became clear that he was the prime candidate to take the club forward. His CV put him on our short list. His references from within the game set him apart.

"I hope that Sunderland fans will all join me in welcoming him to our historic club, as we look forward to an exciting few months."
description: Sunderland have appointed Phil Parkinson as their new manager on a two-and-a-half-year contract.
